ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If only death had really been the end!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: I wish death had put an end to me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Oh! Would that the death that came to me in the world had made an end of me!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Would that death had taken us away for good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Alas, if only it had been just death.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Would that it had been my end!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: O would that it had made an end (of me):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Would it had been the end!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Oh, would that it had been death!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: How I wish my death had ended all.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Oh, would that it had been the ending!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: I wish death had been the end of it all!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Ah! Would that (Death) had made an end of me!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: I wish, would that it had been my end (death)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Would that it (my death) had ended it all!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: If only it was the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: I wish my death had been the decisive one.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:27] O would that it, namely, death in [the life of] this world, had been the [final] end, that had terminated my life, so that I am not resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Oh, would that it had been death!) he will wish for death; he says: I wish I remained dead after my first death.
